mdRecord.dcterms:title: Trinity Episcopal Church, exterior
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Goodhue, Bertram Grosvenor (American architect, 1869-1924) [work]
Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: ... the vestry selected New York architect Bertram Grosvenor Goodhue to design the third Trinity in classic Gothic Revival style. Construction lagged, but in June 1913, the parish celebrated the opening service in its inspiring new structure, highlighted by its sharply pitched slate roof, corner bell tower, and soaring chestnut trusses, and destined in time for the National Register of Historic Places. -- http://www.trinityasheville.org/ourchurch/history.html [work]
